Simulated microdata: EU/EEA (ECDC PPS)

Source: R/bhai_cases_eu.R
bhai_cases_eu.Rd

Case-level simulated microdata for age/sex analyses of HAI burden in the EU/EEA. Each row represents a simulated case with a sampling weight so that weighted sums reproduce the published rates/totals (within uncertainty).

Usage

bhai_cases_eu

Format

A data frame with columns:

hai

character. HAI type (HAP, UTI, BSI, SSI, CDI).

age_group

character. Age band: "0-1", "2-4", ..., "85+".

sex

character. "Female" or "Male".

death

integer. 1 if death occurred, 0 otherwise.

yll

numeric. Years of life lost for this case (0 if death == 0).

yld

numeric. Years lived with disability for this case.

daly

numeric. yll + yld.

weight

numeric. Case weight to scale up to population totals.

Source

Zacher et al. (2019) Eurosurveillance. doi:10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135

Details

These microdata are simulated for teaching/demo from published EU/EEA rates; they are not real patient-level records. For authoritative numbers and figures, consult the Eurosurveillance article.

Examples

data("bhai_cases_eu", package = "BHAIBYE")
# Weighted deaths by HAI type (illustration)
if (requireNamespace("dplyr", quietly = TRUE)) {
  dplyr::summarise(
    dplyr::group_by(bhai_cases_eu, hai),
    deaths_weighted = sum(death * weight)
  )
}
#> # A tibble: 5 × 2
#>   hai   deaths_weighted
#>   <chr>           <dbl>
#> 1 BSI             2080.
#> 2 CDI              924.
#> 3 HAP             3761.
#> 4 SSI             1617.
#> 5 UTI             2726.
